unnormalised: India will not observe DST, keeping it at GMT+5:30 year round. This means during periods when many western countries adjust their clocks for daylight saving, the time difference between India and those nations will shift. For example, the time difference between Delhi and London is normally 4 hrs and 30 mins but during British Summer Time (BST), that difference becomes 3 hrs and 30 mins.
normalised: india will not observe D-S-T, keeping it at G-M-T plus five hours and thirty minutes year round. This means during periods when many western countries adjust their clocks for daylight saving, the time difference between india and those nations will shift. For example, the time difference between delhi and london is normally four hours and thirty minutes but during british summer time (B-S-T), that difference becomes three hours and thirty minutes.

unnormalised: This is because countries like the UK move their clocks forward by 1 hr in the spring and back again in the autumn. The UK observes GMT during the winter and BST during the summer months, impacting time calculations globally from approx. March 31st to Oct 27th.
normalised: This is because countries like the U-K move their clocks forward by one hour in the spring and back again in the autumn. The U-K observes G-M-T during the winter and B-S-T during the summer months, impacting time calculations globally from approximately march thirty first to october twenty seventh.

unnormalised: Similarly, EST (Eastern Standard Time) is normally 9 hrs and 30 mins behind IST. But during EDT (Eastern Daylight Time), that difference shrinks to 8 hrs and 30 mins. So, if it’s 6 PM IST, it could be 8:30 AM EDT instead of the usual 8:30 AM EST.
normalised: Similarly, E-S-T (eastern standard time) is normally nine hours and thirty minutes behind I-S-T. But during E-D-T (eastern daylight time), that difference shrinks to eight hours and thirty minutes. So, if it’s six P-M I-S-T, it could be eight thirty A-M E-D-T instead of the usual eight thirty A-M E-S-T.

unnormalised: It's important for businesses and individuals communicating internationally to keep these shifts in mind especially around 2 AM EDT or 1:30 AM IST when updates or meetings may occur. This info is critical for scheduling calls between teams in Bangalore and New York!
normalised: It's important for businesses and individuals communicating internationally to keep these shifts in mind especially around two A-M E-D-T or one thirty A-M I-S-T when updates or meetings may occur. This info is critical for scheduling calls between teams in bangalore and new york!
